1.    Create an Application Client Project:
   =95    Click File - New - Ot=
her - expand J2EE
   =95    Select Application Client Project and click Nex=
t
   =95    Click Next (leave the default) until you reach the
Application =
Client Module
   =95    Uncheck Create a default Main class
   =95    Click=
 Finish
   =95    Don't worry about the error for now, that will be resolve=
d
until you finish the step 3. Please ignore it for now.
2.    Configure re=
sources for the application client:
   =95    Open the application client d=
eployment descriptor
(application-client.xml)
   =95    Switch to the Refer=
ences tab
   =95    Add resource references such as data sources, or other =
server
resources
3.    Set the build path:
   =95    Right click the newly =
created project > Properties > Java
Build Path
   =95    Switch to the Libr=
aries tab and click Add Variable
   =95    Select the JUNIT_HOME variable a=
nd click Extend
   =95    Select junit.jar
   =95    Click OK
   =95    The=
 previous error should now be gone
4.    Add your JUnit Test Case:
   a)   =
 Create a new JUnit class
      =95    Create a new JUnit test by going to =
File > New > Other >
Java > JUnit > JUnit Test Case
      =95    Fill in th=
e necessary fields and select the checkbox to
create the main method as wel=
l as the TestRunner statement
      =95    Click Next
      =95     Select =
methods to test and click Finish
   b)    Use an existing JUnit class
     =
 =95    Import your existing JUnit class into the appClientModule
directory=

      =95    Add a main method with the line
      =95    junit.textui.Tes=
tRunner.run(<my_class_name>.class);
5.    Update the manifest:
   =95   Dou=
ble click Deploymen Descriptor to Open
   =95    On Main Class (right pane)=
 click Edit
   =95    On the Main Class text box click Browse and locate yo=
ur JUnit
class with the main method
   =95    Save and close the editor
6. =
   Create a new runtime configuration:
   =95    Go to: Run > Run
   =95   =
 Select WebSphere v6.1 Application Client (WAS where you want
to test it an=
d where is your JNDI loaded)
   =95    Click New
   =95    Select your EAR =
file on Enterprise application option
   =95    On Application client modul=
e fields select your Application
Client that you recently created from Step=
 1
   =95    Check enable aplication client to connect to a server
   =95  =
  Select Use Specific Server and choose where you want to run
you JUnit App=
lication Client
   =95    Switch to the Classpath tab
   =95    Click Advan=
ced...
   =95    Select Add Variables and click OK
   =95    Repeat the ins=
tructions from step 3 to add junit.jar
   =95    Click Apply to save the ch=
anges
   =95    Click Run to launch the application client

Note: If you ha=
ve problem connecting to your WAS Bootstrap, you may need
to add a program =
arguments on your Runtime Configuration for Bootstrap.
You can follow the p=
rocedure above if you want to bind your Spring JNDI
to WebSphere JNDI DataS=
ource.
